Class iC_ChartXY

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • icontrol.iC_ChartXY
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class iC_ChartXY
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This is a wrapper class for creating JFreeCharts in a convenient way. Instantiating an object of this class automatically displays a new window (JFrame) with an empty XY-Chart.

    New traces (XYSeries) can be added with defined line style and marker types by calling AddXYSeries. Data points are added to the defined traces by invoking AddXYDataPoints.

    This class implements ActionListener to handle events from a customized PopUp Menu.

    Known issues:

    • Initial tests (110331) indicated that too many charts can occupy too much heap space so that the Java VM crashes. That's why for now the number of data points displayed is limited to 1000. All data points are logged however. It is likely, that this bug was introduced with the Java 6 update 25, but maybe it was also there before. New hints indicate that having more than one window displaying a chart increases instability.

    Some other useful commands:

    • m_Chart.getXAxis().setStandardTickUnits(NumberAxis.createIntegerTickUnits());
    • m_Chart.getXAxis().setNumberFormatOverride(new DecimalFormat("##0.#####E0")); mixed engineering/scientific format
    • m_Chart.getXAxis().setFixedAutoRange(23);
    • m_Chart.LogXAxis(true); (from outside this class)
    • m_Chart.ClearSeries(); (from outside this class)
    • m_Chart.getYAxis(0).setStandardTickUnits(new StandardTickUnitSource()); dynamically create tick units to correctly display very small and very large numbers
    • m_Chart.getYAxis(0).setAutoRangeMinimumSize(1e-15); minimum value used for AutoRanging
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    KPP (Kurt Pernstich: pernstich@alumni.ethz.ch)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        private java.util.ArrayList<org.jfree.data.xy.XYSeriesCollection> m_XYSeriesCollections
        The Collections of multiple XY Series which are displayed in the Chart.
        Each Y-axis has it's own SeriesCollection (and Renderer). The index 0 refers to the SeriesCollection of the default (left) Y axis and it is always present.

      • m_TitleCounter

        private static int m_TitleCounter

      • m_GCcounter

        private static int m_GCcounter
        Counter to manually start Garbage Collection. On a few occasions iC crashed the Java VM without much info what caused the crash. The only info I could extract is that the C heap became too small and JNA cannot allocate memory. When iC crashed, I always had lot's of JFreeCharts open, so it might be related to that. Direct ByteBuffers are not GC automatically, which is a known problem but iC only uses indirect ByteBuffers. So I try starting GC manually after displaying 100 data points. This variable stores how many data points have been plotted since the last GC.

      • m_GUI

        protected static final GUI_Interface m_GUI
        Holds a reference to the IcontrolView class. Using getView to get a handle to the View (to use DisplayStatusMessage etc.) was introduced with JUnit tests on 120727 (v1.3.469).

      • iC_ChartXY

        public iC_ChartXY(java.lang.String Title,
                  java.lang.String XLabel,
                  java.lang.String YLabel,
                  boolean Legend,
                  int PreferredWidth,
                  int PreferredHeight)
        Constructor

        Sets the Title of the JFrame, initializes the Swing components defined by Netbeans (if any), and calls CreatChart which connects the newly created ChartPanel with the JFrame.

        Parameters:
        Title - The title of the Frame (and of the Chart?)
        XLabel - for the chart
        YLabel - for the chart
        Legend - when true, a Legend is shown
        PreferredWidth - The preferred width of the JFrame. If a value equal or below 0 is specified, the default size is set to 640x480.
        PreferredHeight - The preferred height of the JFrame. If a value equal or below 0 is specified, the default size is set to 640x480.

    • Method Detail

      • initComponents

      • CreateChart

        private void CreateChart(java.lang.String XLabel,
                         java.lang.String YLabel,
                         boolean Legend,
                         int PreferredWidth,
                         int PreferredHeight)
        Creates a new JFrame that contains a ChartPanel which in turn contains the XYChart (with no data in it). Use AddXYSeries and AddXYDataPoints to add data points. Called by the Constructor. The chart uses double buffering to display updates and adds entries to the PopUp Menu.

        If either PreferredWidth or PreferredHeight is 0 the preferred size of the chart is set to 640x480.

        See JFreeChart's MultiplePieChartDemo1.java to see how more than one chart fits into one JFrame or XYSplineRenderDemo1.java to see how to create multiple charts in a tabbed view.

        See MultipleDatasetDemo1.java (JFreeChart) to see how buttons can be added to the JFrame. A Menu can simply be added with Netbeans GUI editor.

        See XYSplineRenderDemo1.java (JFreeChart) to see how to created multiple charts in a tabbed view.

        Parameters:
        XLabel - The label of the x-axis of the chart
        YLabel - The label of the y-axis of the chart
        Legend - When true a Legend with the name of the XYSeries specified in will be displayed.
        PreferredWidth - The preferred width of the JFrame. If a value equal or below 0 is specified, the default size is set to 640x480.
        PreferredHeight - The preferred height of the JFrame. If a value equal or below 0 is specified, the default size is set to 640x480.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Method that handles the following Action Events sent from the PopUp Menu:
        - Fixed Auto Range
        - Show/Hide Series

        To ensure robustness of the iC program, any (unexpected) Exception in this method is caught and disregarded. This might result in a non-responsive PopUp Menu but ensures stability of the iC program.

        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        e - Contains information on the event that fired the action

      • AddXYSeries

        public iC_ChartXY.SeriesIdentification AddXYSeries(java.lang.String SeriesName,
                                                   int AxisIndex,
                                                   boolean AutoSort,
                                                   boolean allowDuplicateXValues,
                                                   float[] LineStyle,
                                                   java.awt.Shape Marker)
                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a new trace (XYSeries) to the Chart. Allows to choose which Y-axis is used to display the data and also to set Line Style and Marker preferences.

        Note: Strictly speaking, the SeriesName has to be unique only within the Series' of a Y-axis. But the PopUp Menu that allows to hide and show individual traces also uses the Series Name to identify the trace, it is recommended to use unique SeriesNames over all data series.

        Parameters:
        SeriesName - The name of the series; must be unique or else the two Series appear as one! JFreeChart uses it as a key and also for the legend. Must not be null or else a dummy value is assigned to prevent an IllegalArgumentException (see JFreeChartManual page 896).
        AxisIndex - The index of the axis which should display the data. AxisIndex 0 is always present and refers to the default (left) Y-axis. More axes can be added using newYAxis.
        AutoSort - When true the data is automatically sorted by JFreeChar.
        allowDuplicateXValues - When true identical x-values are allowed by JFreeChart. I am not sure what happens what happens if an identical x-value is added when set to false.
        LineStyle - Specifies the dashing pattern. Use values as defined by BasicStroke or use the predefined values in iC_ChartXY (for instance LINE_DASHED, LINE_SOLID). Can be null in which case JFreeChart uses the default line style (solid line).
        Marker - Shape of the Marker. Can be a custom defined Shape or a predefined value in iC_ChartXY (for instance MARKER_CIRCLE). Can be null in which case no marker is used.
        Returns:
        The index of the added XYSeries. Used to address the DataSeries to add new data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the AxisIndex is out of bounds or the Series could not be added.
        See Also:
        XYSeries, BasicStroke, Shape, ShapeUtilities

      • newYaxis

        public int newYaxis(java.lang.String Label)
        Adds a new Y-axis to the chart.
        Parameters:
        Label - The axis label of the new Y-axis
        Returns:
        The AxisIndex of the newly created axis to be used to access the Data Series Collection (m_XYSeriesCollectionArrayList) and Renderer (m_Renderers) associated with the new axis. Mainly used in AddXYSeries.

      • AddXYDataPoint

        public void AddXYDataPoint(iC_ChartXY.SeriesIdentification SeriesID,
                           double X,
                           double Y)
        Adds a new XY Data Point to the specified XYSeries and updates the chart. If allowDuplicateXValues for this series is set to false and an identical x-value is added, the corresponding y-value is updated with the new y-value.

        When the data point cannot be added to the XYSeries a warning message is displayed in the GUI. This might render the chart somewhat useless but guarantees the stability of the iC Program. This can be caused when an IllegalArgumentException bubbles up from JFreeChart's XYDataItem.addOrUpdate, or when the SeriesID contains an AxisIndex which is out of bounds, or when a negative or zero value is added to a log-axis, and possibly some more cases.

        This method also manually starts Garbage Collection after displaying 500 data points in the hope to prevent the out-of-memory crash (see ChagngeLog 111102)

        Parameters:
        SeriesID - The identification of the XYSeries to which the new data point should be added. The SeriesID is obtained when a new Series is made with AddXYSeries.
        X - The x value of the new data point to display
        Y - The y value of the new data point to display

      • AddXYDataPoints

        public void AddXYDataPoints(iC_ChartXY.SeriesIdentification SeriesID,
                            double[] X,
                            double[] Y)
        Same as #AddXYDataPoints(SeriesIdentification, double, double) but with arrays as input to display in the chart.

        When the data point cannot be added to the XYSeries a warning message is displayed in the GUI. This might render the chart somewhat useless but guarantees the stability of the iC Program. This can be caused when 1) an IllegalArgumentException bubbles up from JFreeChart's XYDataItem.addOrUpdate or 2) when the SeriesID contains an AxisIndex which is out of bounds, or 3) when the arrays X and Y have different lengths.

        Parameters:
        SeriesID - The identification of the XYSeries to which the new data point should be added. The SeriesID is obtained when a new Series is made with AddXYSeries.
        X - The x values of the new data points to display
        Y - The y values of the new data points to display

      • SaveAsPNG

        public void SaveAsPNG(java.io.File file,
                      int Width,
                      int Height)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the Chart in a .png file. If an IOException occurs a Warning message is displayed in the Status Field of the GUI.

        If either Width or Height is 0 the default values are used.

        Parameters:
        file - The file so save the Chart to.
        Width - of the graph.
        Height - of the graph.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When saving failed (bubbles up from JFreeChart)

      • getYAxis

        public org.jfree.chart.axis.NumberAxis getYAxis(int AxisIndex)
        Returns a handle to the Y-axis (Range axis). Can be used to manipulate the axis in more specialized tasks; see the javadoc entry for this class for some useful examples.
        Parameters:
        AxisIndex - The index of the axis for which the handle should be returned. AxisIndex 0 is always present and refers to the default (left) Y-axis. More axes can be added using newYAxis. The AxisIndex might be obtained from a SeriesIdentification object obtained from AddXYSeries.
        Returns:
        A NumberAxis object to access the Range Axis. If the type of the axis is not NumberAxis (which should never occur because XYPlots always have NumberAxis') or the AxisIndex is out of bounds, a new and empty NumberAxis object is returned to prevent null pointer exceptions and avoid try-catch blocks. If such an error occurs the desired result is not obtained, but the stability of the iC Program is guaranteed.

      • getXAxis

        public org.jfree.chart.axis.NumberAxis getXAxis()
        Returns the X-axis (Domain axis). Can be used to manipulate the axis in more specialized tasks; see the javadoc entry for this class for some useful examples.
        Returns:
        A NumberAxis object to access the Range Axis. If the type of the axis is not NumberAxis (which should never occur because XYPlots always have NumberAxis') a new and empty NumberAxis object is returned to prevent null pointer exceptions and avoid try-catch blocks.

      • setAntiAlias

        public boolean setAntiAlias(boolean AntiAliasing)
        Enables or disables AntiAliasing. Disabling AntiAliasing supposedly speeds up drawing the chart, but doesn't look so good. Currently, AntiAliasing for text and lines are not controlled separately.

        Switching off AntiAliasing is not recommended as it is much slower than with AntiAliasing switched off, at least on a Mac.

        Parameters:
        AntiAliasing - When true AntiAliasing is enabled.
        Returns:
        The old state of AntiAliasing

      • setNotify

        public void setNotify(boolean NotifyEventListeners)
        Enables or disables notification of event listeners. This can be used to update the chart only once when multiple data points are added at the same time.
        Parameters:
        NotifyEventListeners - When true the registered event listeners are informed, if false no events are sent.

      • LogXAxis

        public void LogXAxis(boolean LogAxis)
        Changes the scaling of the X axis from linear and logarithmic. This method is also used by actionPerformed when the user selected to change the scaling via the Popup menu.

        Because this method can be called from outside this class, the state of the checkbox entry in the popup menu is updated as well.

        Parameters:
        LogAxis - If true the X axis is shown in a logarithmic scale, if false, a linear scale is used.

      • LogYAxis

        public void LogYAxis(boolean LogAxis)
        Changes the scaling of the first Y axis from linear and logarithmic. This method is also used by actionPerformed when the user selected to change the scaling via the Popup menu.

        Because this method can be called from outside this class, the state of the checkbox entry in the popup menu is updated as well.

        Parameters:
        LogAxis - If true the X axis is shown in a logarithmic scale, if false, a linear scale is used.

      • ClearSeries

        public void ClearSeries(iC_ChartXY.SeriesIdentification SeriesID)
        Removes all XY Data Points from the specified XYSeries and updates the chart.

        Parameters:
        SeriesID - The identification of the XYSeries from which all data points should be removed. The SeriesID is obtained when a new Series is made with AddXYSeries.

      • ShowZeroLines

        public void ShowZeroLines(boolean XAxis,
                          boolean YAxis)
        Shows or hides lines at zero for the X and the first(?) Y axis.
        Parameters:
        XAxis - If set to true, a line a x=0 will be shown
        YAxis - If set to true, a line a y=0 will be shown
